Column Comment.0: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.1: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.2: AGE SEQUENCE NUMBER: rows in this table may be inserted in a meaningfulsequence if desired. This unique number allows rows to be ordered. This columnshould not be used for an ORDINAL AGE, an appropriate column is located in theSTRAT UNIT table.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: AVERAGE AGE: The average age, in years, of the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.5: AVERAGE AGE ERROR MINUS: The negative error in the average age reference
Column Comment.6: AVERAGE AGE ERROR PLUS: The positive error in the average age reference.
Column Comment.7: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.8: AVERAGE RELATIVE STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT ID: unique identifier for thestratigraphic unit that represents the relative (chronologic) age of this stratigraphicunit.
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.10: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.11: LOWER MAXIMUM AGE: The maximum lower age, in years, of the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.12: AGE ERROR MINUS: the negative error in the age.
Column Comment.13: AGE ERROR PLUS: the positive error in the age.
Column Comment.14: LOWER MINIMUM AGE: The minimum lower age, in years, of the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.15: AGE ERROR MINUS: the negative error in the age.
Column Comment.16: AGE ERROR PLUS: the positive error in the age.
Column Comment.17: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.18: LOWER RELATIVE STRAT UNIT ID: The name of the chronostratigraphic age that isthe equivalent of the age.
Column Comment.19: MAXIMUM AGE: Maximum geochronological age of the strat unit. Defines theearliest existance of a unit within the geologic record and positions the lowerboundary of the unit within a geologic column and on a stratigraphic chart.
Column Comment.20: MAXIMUM AGE ERROR MINUS: Negative bound of error estimate of maximum age.
Column Comment.21: MAXIMUN AGE ERROR PLUS: Positive bound of error estimate of maximum age.
Column Comment.22: MINIMUM AGE: Minimum geochronological age of the strat unit -defines the end ofdeposition (or other rock building process) of a unit within the geologic record andpositions the upper boundary of the unit within a geologic column and on astratigraphic chart.
Column Comment.23: MINIMIM AGE ERROR MINUS: Negative bound of error estimate of minimum age.
Column Comment.24: MINIMUN AGE ERROR PLUS: Positive bound of error estimate of minimum age.
Column Comment.25: POST QUALIFIER: qualifier for the end of the row of data.
Column Comment.26: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.27: PREFERRED INDICATOR: a yes / no flag that indicates whether this data is apreferred version that should be used for reports and maps
Column Comment.28: PRE QUALIFIER: qualifying statement for the beginning of the row of data.
Column Comment.29: REMARK: narrative comments about the age.
Column Comment.30: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.31: SOURCE DOCUMENT: A list of documents that are used as the source for supplyingdata. Source documents may include government and regulatory forms, operatorreports or scout tickets, publications, news letters, books or jounals.
Column Comment.32: REFERENCE STRATIGRAPHIC AGE METHOD: The method used to determine theage of this stratigraphic unit, such as radiometric, fossil analysis etc.
Column Comment.33: UPPER MAXIMUM AGE: The maximum upper age, in years, of the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.34: AGE ERROR MINUS: the negative error in the age.
Column Comment.35: AGE ERROR PLUS: the positive error in the age.
Column Comment.36: UPPER MINIMUM AGE: The minimum upper age, in years, of the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.37: AGE ERROR MINUS: the negative error in the age.
Column Comment.38: AGE ERROR PLUS: the positive error in the age.
Column Comment.39: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.40: UPPER RELATIVE STRAT UNIT ID: The chronostratigraphic unit that is the upperequivalent age.
Column Comment.41: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.42: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.43: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.44: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.45: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.46: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.47: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
